scenarioDescription:
The NN Ser Exoplanetary System


Overview

NN Ser is a star with 0.54 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 1682.37 light years away from the solar system.

NN Ser is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the NN Ser system


NN Ser c

NN Ser c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2010-10, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 5.35 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of NN Ser c is 2330.940 times the mass of Earth. The radius of NN Ser c is 12.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NN Ser c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


NN Ser d

NN Ser d was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2010-10, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 3.43 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of NN Ser d is 731.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of NN Ser d is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NN Ser d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system NN Ser, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: NN Ser - System With 2 Exoplanets
